discussion.p:
Since a concept's type always must be bool, there seems little reason to require the source code to say so explicitly. Typing concept should be sufficient without also typing bool immediately afterward.
Allow the compiler to supply bool (a) as the implicit return type for a function concept and (b) as the implicit type for a variable concept. (Note: this comment is implicitly accepted if issue is accepted.)
Also see issues and as they relate.
EWG is generally in favor of resolving this and related issues, but there is no consensus on how to procdeed.
